data.title: Uncaught Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, lstat '/Users/pauline/Downloads/Atom.app'

data.title: Rename ATOM_REPO to ATOM_PUBLISH_REPO and always publish when it is set
Uncaught TypeError: item.save is not a function
data.body:
1. I Closed a tab: a document without title.
2. I have a init script:

```
atom.getCurrentWindow().on 'blur', ->
  for pane in atom.workspace.getPanes()
    for item in pane.items
      if item.isModified?
        item.save() if item.isModified()
      else
        item.save()

```

**Atom Version**: 1.8.0
**System**: Ubuntu 14.04.4
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught TypeError: item.save is not a function

```
At /home/peter/.atom/init.coffee:18

TypeError: item.save is not a function
    at /home/peter/.atom/init.coffee:18:14
    at /home/peter/.atom/init.coffee:14:5
    at CallbacksRegistry.apply (/usr/share/atom/resources/atom.asar/common/api/lib/callbacks-registry.js:58:39)
    at EventEmitter.<anonymous> (/usr/share/atom/resources/atom.asar/renderer/api/lib/remote.js:236:28)
    at emitThree (events.js:97:13)
    at EventEmitter.emit (events.js:175:7)
```
### Config

``` json
{
  "core": {
    "themes": [
      "atom-dark-ui",
      "one-light-syntax"
    ]
  },
  "editor": {
    "tabLength": 4
  }
}
```
### Installed Packages

``` coffee
# User
atom-autocomplete-php, v0.18.9
emmet, v2.4.3
php-analyser, v0.2.0
php-integrator-base, v1.0.7
php-integrator-linter, v1.0.1

# Dev
No dev packages
```

data.title: Correctly link the safe mode section
Introduce CircleCI for macOS builds
data.body:
Depends on #11897. This is the [actual diff](https://github.com/atom/atom/compare/mkt-use-apm-with-npm3-and-node-4...as-circle-ci).

This pull-request tries to supplant Travis and replace it with CircleCI. After trying it out for a while, the build process seems more reliable and faster as well. Moreover, if CircleCI enables parallelism for macOS containers in the future, we could be able to speed up our test suite very easily.

Right now the build fails because of some flaky tests that are not related to CircleCI at all (i.e. Janky and Travis fail too for the same specs), but overall I think we might be able to 🚢 this and let it run alongside Travis for a while so that we can assess how well it performs. If after the test-drive everything looks good, we can :fire: Travis and use CircleCI only.

This is the plan we're on right now:

![screen shot 2016-07-20 at 20 47 37](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/482957/17016782/e2e37304-4f30-11e6-9976-e367fb17b27f.png)

After the experimentation phase, I believe we should switch initially to **Startup** and consider **Growth** too if we run out of minutes.

/cc: @nathansobo @iolsen @atom/core

data.title: Dock menu: multiple entries of the same file
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [✓] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [✓] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [✓] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [✓] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [✓] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [✓] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Multiple entries of of the same file in the right click menu.

![Screenshot](https://www.dropbox.com/s/fgtxcanra0p3wxa/Screenshot%202016-07-20%2023.43.16.png?dl=1)
### Steps to Reproduce

Not found.

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

One entry per file in menu.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

Multiple entries for the same file.
### Versions

OS X El Capitan 10.11.6 Beta (15G26a)

Atom      : 1.8.0
Electron : 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node      : 5.1.1

data.title: Atom crashes with reload notice when I open a file which stored in a remote server and share by samba protocol.
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Atom crashes with _reload notice_ when I open a file which stored in a remote server and share by **samba** protocol.I have tried Atom 1.8 version and 1.9.0-beta0 version, but it don't work : (
### Steps to Reproduce
1. open a folder shared by **samba** protocol
2. open a file by click file name
3. it crashes

**Expected behavior:** open the file.

**Actual behavior:** it crashes.
### Versions
- Atom version(**I try atom 1.8, it don't work.**)
  Atom    : 1.9.0-beta0
  Electron: 0.37.8
  Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
  Node    : 5.10.0
- OS version
  Microsoft Windows [version 6.1.7601]
- Samba version
  Samba version 3.0.10-1.4E.6

data.title: Uninstalling failes for any package.
data.body:
### Description

Uninstalling “xxxxxxx” failed.
Failed to delete xxxxxxx: Does not exist
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Go to "File -> Settings"
2. Click on "Package" and select any package.
3. Click "Uninstall"

**Expected behavior:** 
Package should uninstall with success message.

**Actual behavior:** 
Package uninstalls but with error message as mentioned in description.

**Note:**
- package will not be in list if I restart Atom application.
- I noticed in windows 8 system
### Versions

Atom version in 1.8.0,

data.title: Update languages
data.body:
- language-coffee-script
  - Improved auto-indentation logic
- language-css
  - Added `stroke-` property names
- language-git
  - Added support for `exec` in rebases
- language-go
  - Changed `main` snippet to `pkgm` for user friendliness
- language-html
  - Removed unsupported `charset` attribute in the `link` snippet
  - Added support for `x-template` scripts
- language-json
  - Added support for `.tfstate` files
- language-less
  - Fixed character escaping
- language-php
  - Updated snippet scopes
- language-ruby
  - Fixed `do` tokenization including spaces
  - Cleaned up the regexes
  - Improved number tokenization
- language-sass
  - Cleaned up the regexes
  - Fixed variables in maps
  - Fixed maps in maps
  - Fixed various tokenization issues
    - RGB values
    - Poor tokens
    - Property names in property values
  - Fixed pseudo-classes not including the preceding colon
  - Fixed character escaping
- language-sql
  - Added support for `EXCEPT` and `EXCEPT ALL`
  - Added support for `USE`, `GO`, `INTO`, `EXEC`, and `OPENQUERY`
  - Added support for `DECLARE`
- language-xml
  - Added support for `.ui` files
  - Added support for `.glade` files

Huge thanks to @esdoppio for contributing many of these changes, as well as to everyone else who opened all those PRs :smile:.

data.title: User stylehseet doesn't auto-reload on initial creation
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

If your user stylesheet is empty (or doesn't exist?) when Atom is loaded making changes to it do nothing until the editor is restarted.  Once restarted they live-reload as expected
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Erase (or delete?) user stylesheet
2. Open new editor
3. Change user stylesheet
4. Notice that changes are ignored

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]
1. Changes should be reloaded
### Versions

➜  ~ atom --version
Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
➜  ~ apm --version
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.8.0-rc2

data.title: Right clicking in window doesn't give that window focus
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

I often have two atom windows open side-by-side.  If I right click on one (e.g. to create a new file), I often end up typing the file name in the other.  It's rather annoying.

Note that this is a different issue than #2991, I'm referring to focusing the entire window, not an item.

OSX 10.11.5
Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

This is possibly an issue with Electron; if I should move it there let me know :)

data.title: Redoing changes that include a new line mixes up line endings on Windows
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

When editing a text file, any changes including new lines that are applied using the redo option appear to be coerced to LF endings instead of CRLF endings as one might expect on Windows. I've only noticed this recently while editing files with some linter packages, which immediately highlight inconsistencies with line endings.

See my screen capture below for an illustration of this problem.

![redoproblem](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2031402/16984950/df07d2ce-4eaf-11e6-8c07-4e8b300ec2a9.gif)

I had a quick poke around the Atom code base but nothing stood out to me. It's probably something to do with the `text-buffer` dependency.
### Steps to Reproduce

Enabling invisible characters will help visualise this problem.
1. Open a new file in Atom and add some lines using the <kbd>ENTER</kbd> key.
2. Undo all the lines (i.e. <kbd>CTRL</kbd> + <kbd>Z</kbd>).
3. Redo all the lines (i.e. <kbd>CTRL</kbd> + <kbd>Y</kbd>).

**Expected behavior:** All the line endings inserted by the redo action should use CRLF endings instead of LF.

**Actual behavior:** Redo actions insert LF endings.
### Versions
- Atom 1.8.0
- apm 1.9.2
- Windows 10 Pro

data.title: Fixed undefined ATOM_HOME
data.body:
`ATOM_HOME` is `undefined`, which breaks Atom on startup (at least on Mac). Interesting that it is `undefined` even when I explicitly set this variable in `.bashrc`.

The patch is a one-liner for simplicity:
- It checks, if `ATOM_HOME` is falsy. If it is:
  - It checks if `HOME` is truthy. If it is:
    - It sets `ATOM_HOME` to `path.join(HOME, '.atom')`.
  - Otherwise it sets it to an empty string.

The description above dwarves the code.

I don't know what caused the problem, because I saw it before intermittently, but recently I updated node to 6.3.0, and Mac to 10.11.6. The combined change made the problem persistent.

Before debugging the code I tried to reinstall Atom 1.8.0, and 1.9.0-beta0 — both fail the same way (`undefined` is passed to `path.join()`).

data.title: Atom Save As...broken on Sierra Public Beta
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [ ] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [ ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Atom 1.9.0-beta0 saves files to the wrong directory when using the dialog expanded mode.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Save As...
2. Select a directory using the Save As.. Dialog expansion. Navigate to a chosen directory
3. Press Save
4. File is saved at the same level as the selected directory and NOT within it.

**Expected behavior:** Save to the proper directory selected within the Save As.. dialog
**Actual behavior:** Only seems to happen when the Save As.. Dialog is expanded to allow Finder like navigation.  Saves at the same level as the directory selected and not within the directory itself. 

Have gotten it to work by not expanding and using the default Finder toolbar directory pull down only. Tricky. Workaround is of course to move the file in Terminal or the Finder etc..
### Versions

macOS Sierra Public Beta 10.12 Beta (16A238m)

atom --version
Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.8.4

data.title: Atom UI elements with selectable text don't respect system default copy/paste keys
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Some UI elements with text in Atom can be selected/highlighted and then copy pasted. Some examples of this are some of the texts in the Settings-menu and errors messages on Linter panels.
The usually use-case for me is taking an error message spat out by the linter (or other checker) from a panel and Googling it.  On MacOS, unlike on Windows, the default copy-paste combinations are `cmd`-based, `cmd-c`, `cmd-v` (while the Windows ones are `ctrl-c, ctrl-v`). However, the only way to copy selected text from Atom UI is through the `ctrl`-key, despite `cmd` being the preferred key on MacOS.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. On MacOS X...
2. Open Settings
3. Highlight some text
4. Copy the text with `cmd-c` and paste it
5. Copy the text with `ctrl-c` and paste it

**Expected behavior:**

Clipboard contains the copied text during step 3, nothing is copied during step 4.

**Actual behavior:** 

Nothing is copied to clipboard during step 3, text is copied during step 4.
### Versions

MacOS X El Capitan (10.11.6)
Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.11
git 2.8.2

Quite a minor issue, but still an annoyance. 🐈

data.title: Upgrading to Electron v1+? Better ES6 Support
data.body: The current version of Atom (v1.8) is using Electron v0.36.8 internally (`process.versions.electron`). Is there a plan to upgrade to Electron v1 +so that many more native ES6 features can be used via NodeJS 6+?

data.body:

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

I can't open file/folder or create new project in new window
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open atom (I created project earlier)
   ![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5184847/16922450/3cf44eaa-4d1e-11e6-95c3-bf224ba5bab2.png)
   In this window all OK, i can open any files/folder
2. I want to create new window and open folder at this window (**File - New Window**)
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5184847/16922542/9fa239ae-4d1e-11e6-97cd-5d223f6312f7.png)
   All OK at this step
3. Next I try to open some folder (**File - Open File**)
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5184847/16922568/c685480e-4d1e-11e6-8482-2ec2876c2891.png)
4. After OK button clicking i get an error
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5184847/16922582/dbb55962-4d1e-11e6-86c1-ddc04cb856e7.png)

**Expected behavior:** My folder must be open in new window
**Actual behavior:** I got an error
### Versions

```
atom --version
Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

apm --version
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.6
git 1.9.1

cat /etc/lsb-release
DISTRIB_ID=LinuxMint
DISTRIB_RELEASE=17.3
DISTRIB_CODENAME=rosa
DISTRIB_DESCRIPTION="Linux Mint 17.3 Rosa"

uname -a
Linux mint-17 3.16.0-38-generic #52~14.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Fri May 8 09:43:57 UTC 2015 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

data.title: I want to keep symlinked path when file opened with ATOM
data.body:
Hello!

I have symlink component in my project's path. Atom is expanding it to the original path. But I want to keep "symlink" components inside it.

I have following environment.

Folder with files:

```
mkdir ~/myapp_original_path
echo "hello world" > ~/myapp_original_path/index.txt
```

Folder which uses files from first folder and do not store anything actually:

```
mkdir ~/myapp_symlinked_path
ln -s  ~/myapp_original_path ~/myapp_symlinked_path/myproject
```

ls -la output looks as following:

```
ls -al ~/myapp_original_path
total 8
drwxr-xr-x   3 pavel  staff   102 18 Jul 16:57 .
drwxr-xr-x+ 41 pavel  staff  1394 18 Jul 16:52 ..
-rw-r--r--   1 pavel  staff    12 18 Jul 16:55 index.txt
```

And for fake folder:

```
ls -al ~/myapp_symlinked_path/
total 8
drwxr-xr-x   3 pavel  staff   102 18 Jul 16:57 .
drwxr-xr-x+ 41 pavel  staff  1394 18 Jul 16:52 ..
lrwxr-xr-x   1 pavel  staff    32 18 Jul 16:57 myproject -> /Users/pavel/myapp_original_path
```

So I could use both patches for accessing index.txt (original):
`~/myapp_original_path/index.txt`

Or I could use path with symlink jump inside it:
`~/myapp_symlinked_path/myproject/index.txt`

But when I'm trying to open second path (with symlink component) with atom:
`atom ~/myapp_symlinked_path/myproject/index.txt`

I'm still getting original path:

``` /Users/pavel/myapp_original_path/index.txt```

And it broke my hack for Go enabled project. 

How I could tune / change this behaviour? I could accept source code changes too ;)
```

data.title: Remove unused variables (advanced)
data.body:
Let's see how well this goes. :pray: 

I was reading some text-editor related code and was mildly frustrated to find some unused variables. I added [coffeescope](https://github.com/za-creature/coffeescope) for coffeelint and started manually excluding global classes and variables until it found the following unused variables/undefined references.

~~There are still unused variables in `try ... catch unusedVariable` statements, but these cannot be cleaned up as it requires a more up to date version of coffeescript dependency in grunt or the code won't transpile.~~ Updated coffeescript.

If ~~we do have a more recent version of coffeescript, grunt and~~ a false positive regarding `for x,y of z` in coffeescope#7 has been fixed ~~(which in programming speak is _never_)~~, it might be worthwhile adding coffeescope permanently to find code like this.

Update 30.08.2016: There is still some configuration overhead with the coffeescope, as there are certain things that are defined in helpers and elsewhere, which would have to be whitelisted manually.

data.title: editor:move-to-beginning-of-screen-line moves cursor to the end of the previous line
data.body:
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open file with at least one line of text
2. Turn Soft Wrap on, if it's not already
3. Indent line at least once
4. Resize window so line soft wraps
5. Fire `editor:move-to-beginning-of-screen-line` with cursor positioned anywhere on any screen line, except for the first screen line or any other screen line's first character

![Soft-wrapped lines with indentation](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6350880/16905560/65cb0ce4-4c6d-11e6-9349-32f29b808eb3.png)

**Expected behavior:** Cursor moves to beginning of current line

**Actual behavior:** Cursor moves to the end of the previous line
### Versions

OS X 10.11.5
Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

data.title: Update select-to-end-of-line behavior
data.body:
Original PR is in atom/atom#12117, but I borked my local repo and started over. Only after I did that did I learn how to fix it :persevere:

Addresses atom#7159, where `editor:select-to-end-of-line` should behave similarly to `editor:move-to-end-of-line`. This PR does the following to make functions behave as expected and provide functions for existing behaviors (all select/move functions do so from the cursor position to the specified position):
- `editor:select-to-beginning-of-line`: **Unchanged,** selects to the beginning of the buffer line
- `editor:select-to-beginning-of-screen-line`: **New,** selects to the beginning of the screen line
- `editor:select-to-end-of-line`: **Changed,** selects to the end of the buffer line, originally selected to the end of the screen line
- `editor:select-to-end-of-screen-line`: **New,** selects to the end of the screen line, original behavior of `editor:select-to-end-of-line`
- `editor:select-to-first-character-of-line`: **Changed,** selects to the first non-whitespace character of the buffer line, originally selected to the first non-whitespace character of the screen line
- `editor:select-to-first-character-of-screen-line`: **New,** selects to the first non-whitespace character of the screen line, same behavior as original `select-to-first-character-of-line`
- `editor:move-to-first-character-of-line`: **Changed,** moves the cursor to the first non-whitespace character of the buffer line, originally moved to the first non-whitespace character of the screen line
- `editor:move-to-first-character-of-screen-line`: **New,** moves the cursor to the first non-whitespace character of the screen line, original behavior of `editor:move-to-first-character-of-line`

@lee-dohm, I expanded your [original checklist](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12117#issuecomment-232172717) to include the first-character functions because it followed the same logic as the other function changes. Admittedly, I've never written specs before, but I'm familiar with Jasmine. Any guidance for writing specs for this would be super helpful.
### TODO:
- [ ] Write specs
- [ ] Cleanup, including old commented code and extra space around new code
- [ ] Decide if the `home` and `end` keys should act on the screen or buffer line. Currently it's the screen line
- [ ] Modify new screen line functions in `menus/linux.cson` and `menus/win32.cson` to have shortcuts (at lease I think that's what the ampersand is for on the menu labels. I'm on a Mac :apple:)
- [ ] Edit 2.2 and 2.3 in atom/flight-manual.atom.io to reflect new functions

data.title: blue dots in tabs for files changed are hard to read
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
  yes
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
  yes
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
  yes
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
  yes
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
  yes
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
  yes
  For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

The blue dot that symbolizes file changes that haven't been saved is overlapping the file name. This causes some very annoying problems:
- it's so easy to miss that I sometimes forget to save file changes
- makes it harder to read the file name

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/452219/16897895/4a615ca8-4b76-11e6-9ee5-d7113052c26b.png)
### Steps to Reproduce
1. make a change to any file
2. try reading the text in the tab, you'll see a blue dot on top of the text

**Expected behavior:** Blue dot should have a margin so you can clearly see it and also be able to clearly read the file name.

**Actual behavior:** Blue dot is on top of the text, making it not obvious which files have changed, causing me to forget to save file changes.
### Versions

Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

Mac OSX El Capitan
